title: Default inheritance option
author: Zewwy
body_snippet:
Inheritance on sub folder and connections within should have inherit all to yes as default

## Expected Behavior
Create a Parent folder, set your folder properties. Create a Sub folder within it, it should have all the properties of it's parent automatically.

## Current Behavior
I have to select the inheritance Icon, set inherit All: Yes
For every sub folder, and every sub connection.

## Possible Solution
Set inheritance to be default to yes. If I had to do this in Windows folder cre...

comments.author: Zewwy
comments.snippet: i did make this work by going to the top root connection object, which highlights the default inheritance icon, and set all to yes. now creating sub folders and connections inherit from their parents on creation, be nice if you could set that at a folder level instead for a bit more flex.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet:
To set the default values of newly created connections, click the root connection node in the connection tree and then select the two buttons in the "Config" window (default inheritance). This will let you inherit any/all settings by default when new connections/folders are created.
